CatDescriptText: Velma Fitzgerald, 1015 Gerritt Street, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, March 8, 1958, pg. 3 with question: "Do you think that discrimination and segregation exist in Pittsburgh public school system?" Answer reads: "No, I really do not think that there are segregation and discrimination in the schools of the Pittsburgh public school system.  I really do not know for certain, but I just can't believe that such conditions exist here."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Velma Fitzgerald wearing dark coat with hood, standing in front of building with sign inscribed "$1.35 Roast Ground of Beef, Baked Ham, Served in Grill N' Quill Lounge to 2:30 pm daily Sat. Sun. & Holidays"
